snippet: The court found that in 1973 an American naval officer provided Chilean officials with information on two Americans, which led to their executions as part of a coup that ousted President Salvador Allende.
abstract: Chilean court finds United States military intelligence services played a pivotal role in setting up murders of American citizens, filmmaker Charles Horman and student activist Frank Teruggi, in 1973; rules American naval officer Ray E Davis alerted Chilean officials to their activities, which led to their arrests and executions.
lead_paragraph: The court found that in 1973 an American naval officer provided Chilean officials with information on two Americans, which led to their executions as part of a coup that ousted President Salvador Allende.

headline.main: Chilean Court Rules U.S. Had Role in Murders
headline.print_headline: Chilean Court Rules U.S. Had Role in Murders
